column1: Reactive attachment disorder is a problem with social interaction that occurs when a child's basic physical and emotional needs are neglected, particularly when the child is an infant.

Reactive attachment disorder is caused by abuse or neglect of an infant's needs for: - Emotional bonds with a primary or secondary caretaker - Food - Physical safety - Touching An infant or child may be neglected when the: - Caregiver is intellectually disabled - Caregiver lacks parenting skills - Parents are isolated - Parents are teenagers A frequent change in caregivers (for example, in orphanages or foster care) is another cause of reactive attachment disorder.
